search_parameters.q: Campus Dissent and Academic Punishment: The Response of College Professors to Local Political Activism Abramson, Harold J. Wences, Rosalio Sociology of Education

search_information.query_displayed: Campus Dissent and Academic Punishment: The Response of College Professors to Local Political Activism Abramson, Harold J. Wences, Rosalio Sociology of Education

organic_results.title: Campus dissent and academic punishment: the response of college professors to local political activism
organic_results.snippet: The votes of college professors on three resolutions dealing with penalties for local campus unrest are analyzed on a scale of tolerance of political nonconformity. Years in residence at the institution and academic rank proved to be most strongly related to tolerance. Control for longevity considerably weakened the influence of department or discipline. The longevity factor revealed the existence of a local culture, crucial for differentiating reactions to local dissent and unorthodox political behavior.

publication_info.summary: HJ Abramson, R Wences - Sociology of Education, 1972 - JSTOR
